items.title: Kelly Clarkson to End Daytime Talk Show After 7Â Years
items.summary: The host said she made the decision to â€œprioritize my kids, which feels necessary and right for this next chapter of our lives.â€
items.body: Kelly Clarkson and NBCUniversal announced Monday (Feb. 2) that The Kelly Clarkson Show will end after its current season. Production on season 7 will continue as planned, with episodes airing through the fall. In a statement, Clarkson said she made the decision to step away from the show to â€œprioritize my kids, which feels necessary and right for this next chapter of our lives.â€ She has two children, daughter River, 11, and son Remington, 9, with former husband (and former manager) Brandon Blackstock, who died of melanoma six months ago at age 48. Related Kelly Clarkson Wins One, Loses One at 2024 Daytime Emmys Kelly Clarkson Shares Rare Update on Her Kids After Ex Brandon Blackstockâ€™s Death Kelly Clarkson Tells Fans She’s ‘Bummed’ Her Talk Show Stops Her From Touring During NJ Concert â€œI have been extremely fortunate to work with such an outstanding group of people at TKCS , both in Los Angeles and New York,â€ Clarkson said in a statement on Instagram . â€œThere have been so many amazing moments and shows over these seven seasons. I am forever grateful and honored to have worked alongside the greatest band and crew you could hope for, all the talent â€¦

items.title: 2026 Grammys Share the Love Among Pop Winners Lola Young, Lady Gaga, Billie Eilish, Olivia Dean &Â More
items.summary: On the new Billboard Pop Shop Podcast, Katie & Keith are talking about Sunday's show, where four different artists won in the Big Four categories.
items.body: There was a lot of pop love to go around at Sunday’s 2026 Grammy Awards , where four different artists won in the Big Four categories and the pop categories shared the wealth. Related Here Are the 2026 Grammys Winners: Full List It's Their Moment: Lady Gaga, 'Golden,' Sabrina Carpenter & More 2026 Grammy Pop Predictions From Harry's House to Harry's 'Disco': Harry Styles Is Back With a New Song & Album to Answer Our Pop Prayers While she lost best new artist to Olivia Dean, Lola Young was a surprise winner in best pop solo performance for “Messy.” And even though Cynthia Erivo & Ariana Grande’s “Defying Gravity” duet won for best pop duo/group performance, “Golden” from KPop Demon Hunters got its win elsewhere, for best song written for visual media. Lady Gaga might have missed out on a Big Four win, but she was still a two-time winner on Sunday night (best pop vocal album for MAYHEM and best dance pop recording for “Abracadabra”). And Billie Eilish even snagged an award for a track from her 2024 album, when “Wildflower” won song of the year. Listen to the neâ€¦

items.title: Pandora Settles Lawsuit Over Royalties for Robin Williams, George Lopez & More ComedyÂ Routines
items.summary: The streamer says the deal doesn't alter its existing royalties structure for comedy sets.
items.body: Pandora has settled with comedians in a closely-watched legal dispute over spoken-word content licensing, though the streamer says it still isnâ€™t paying the equivalent of publishing royalties sought in the comicsâ€™ lawsuit. Nine comedians and their heirs, including George Lopez, Lewis Black and the estates of deceased legends Robin Williams and George Carlin , have been fighting since 2022 to increase the royalties paid when their comedy sets are streamed on Pandora. Lawyers for the comics and Pandora agreed on a confidential settlement during a court-refereed mediation on Wednesday (Jan. 28), court records show. Related Comedians Want Pandora to Pay More Royalties. A New Report Says It Doesn’t Need to The comediansâ€™ lawsuit had aimed to align their royalties structure with that of music streaming, where artists are paid for both sound recordings (masters) and the underlying written music (publishing). Comics have historically been paid digital streaming royalties only for their recorded comedy routines, not the underlying jokes themselves. The comedians did not ultimately achieve this goal, according to a spokesperson for Pandoraâ€™s parent company SiriusXM, who said in aâ€¦

items.title: Chappell Roan Is â€˜Gigglingâ€™ Over Reaction to Her Sheer Grammy Dress: â€˜I Donâ€™t Even Think This Is THAT Outrageous of anÂ Outfitâ€™
items.summary: The pop singer/songwriter made headlines with the bold nipple-ring dress.
items.body: Chappell Roan is having a good laugh after her barely-there 2026 Grammys red-carpet outfit made headlines around the world on Sunday night. The controversial look — a custom maroon Mugler gown based on the designer’s 1998 nipple-ring dress — started out covered in a sheer cape before Roan shed the layer and unveiled the topless style. Related Chappell Roan Brings Back Mugler’s Nipple Ring Dress at the 2026 Grammys Here Are the 2026 Grammys Winners: Full List 2026 Grammys: Here's What You Didn't See on TV “Giggling because I donâ€™t even think this is THAT outrageous of an outfit,” Roan captioned a carousel of photos posted to her Instagram on Monday (Feb. 2). “The lookâ€™s actually so awesome and weird. I recommend just exercising your free will itâ€™s really fun and silly ğŸ˜€ Thank you for having me @grammys and those who voted for me!!” Billboard ‘s video of Roan on the red carpet from Sunday night is at a whopping 52 million views (and counting) on Instagram, with comments ranging from “I love her but this is too much. Is she gonna get banned?” to “Okay but she really ate this look up.” Râ€¦

items.title: Bruce Springsteenâ€™s Anti-ICE Song â€˜Streets of Minneapolisâ€™ Makes No. 1 SalesÂ Debut
items.summary: The song was the most-downloaded in the U.S. despite just two days of availability during the tracking week.
items.body: Bruce Springsteen â€™s â€œStreets of Minneapolisâ€ was the highest-selling song in the United States last week, even with it being available for just two days of the tracking period, debuting at No. 1 on Billboard â€™s Digital Song Sales chart dated Feb. 7. In the week ending Jan. 29, â€œStreets of Minneapolisâ€ sold 16,000 downloads, according to Luminate. It was released Jan. 28. Related Bruce Springsteen’s Poignant ‘Streets of Minneapolis’ Video Compiles Footage of ICE Aggression Bruce Springsteen Joins Tom Morello in Minnesota for First Live Performance of ‘Streets of Minneapolis’ Jeremy Allen White & the Cast of ‘Deliver Me From Nowhere’ Share Their First Memories of Bruce Springsteen | Billboard â€œStreets of Minneapolisâ€ marks Springsteenâ€™s first No. 1 on the all-format Digital Song Sales survey, which began in 2004 following the proliferation of paid downloads on the internet. In fact, itâ€™s his first track to reach the rankingâ€™s top 20, exceeding the No. 22 peak of Mark Knopflerâ€™s Guitar Heroesâ€™ â€œGoing Home (Theme From Local Hero),â€ for which he joined its all-star cast , in 2024. Attention around â€œStreets of Minneapolisâ€ stems fâ€¦

items.title: Billboardâ€™s Music Industry EventsÂ Calendar
items.summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
items.body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. items.title: NASA Astronaut to Answer Questions from Students in Pennsylvania
items.summary: NASA astronaut Chris Williams will connect with students in Pennsylvania to answer prerecorded science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) questions while aboard the International Space Station. The Earth-to-space call will begin at 12:20 p.m. EST Thursday, Feb. 5, and will stream liveâ€¦
items.body: NASA astronauts Chris Williams and Zena Cardman, both Expedition 74 flight engineers, work on spacesuit maintenance inside the International Space Station’s Quest airlock on Dec. 16, 2025. Credit: NASA NASA astronaut Chris Williams will connect with students in Pennsylvania to answer prerecorded science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) questions while aboard the International Space Station . The Earth-to-space call will begin at 12:20 p.m. EST Thursday, Feb. 5, and will stream live on the agencyâ€™s Learn With NASA YouTube channel. Media interested in covering the event must RSVP by 5 p.m., Wednesday, Feb. 4, to Tamara Krizek at: 917-692-5038 or tamara.krizek@davincisciencecenter.org . The Da Vinci Science Center will host this event in Allentown, Pennsylvania, for students in kindergarten through grade 12, and members of the community. This unique opportunity aims to deepen understanding of space exploration and inspire young people to pursue a future career in STEM. For more than 25 years, astronauts have continuously lived and worked aboard the space station, testing technologies, performing science, and developing skills needed to explore farther from Earthâ€¦

items.title: Charli xcx Says â€˜Bratâ€™ Era Opened Her Up to a â€˜New Audienceâ€™ That â€˜Didnâ€™t Really GetÂ Meâ€™
items.summary: The star added that some people "connected with me" and some "only connected with aspects of me."
items.body: Charli xcx ‘s 2024 Brat album changed her trajectory as an artist — but with it came a lot of new eyeballs on her at all times. And that was one of the main points of inspiration for creating The Moment , the British dance-pop star’s mockumentary that premiered on Jan. 30. The chaotic, Aidan Zamiri-directed film takes an exaggerated look at Charli’s fame-boosting Brat era, with the singer/songwriter telling Billboard in a video interview posted Monday (Feb. 2) that she was inspired by the “transition” she experienced in real life. Related Charli xcx & Aidan Zamiri Talk Meeting Meredith Marks, Wrecking Karaoke Rooms on Set for â€™The Momentâ€™ | Billboard News Charli xcx Unveils ‘Wuthering Heights’ Tracklist Featuring Surprise Collab With Sky Ferreira Charli xcx’s ‘Brat’ Era Is a ‘Dead Horse’ She Can’t Stop Beating in ‘Residue’ Video Featuring a Major Celeb Cameo “I’d been this relatively niche artist, and then had suddenly been opened up to this huge new audience, some of whom really connected with me, some of whom only connected with aspects of me, some of whâ€¦

items.title: 'Amazing' first career win for history maker Aswat
items.summary: Aamilah Aswat makes history as the first female black British jump jockey to win a UK horse race.

items.title: Wolves complete signings of Gomes and Armstrong
items.summary: Wolves seal the signings of England midfielder Angel Gomes from Marseille and striker Adam Armstrong from Southampton.

items.title: Two club-record signings - but are Palace papering over the cracks?
items.summary: Crystal Palace end a horrendous January with a rollercoaster day - but are they just papering over the cracks?

items.title: Tidal rolling out Android Auto fix for playback-breaking bug
items.summary: A week after users began experiencing an issue with the Tidal app in Android Auto, the company has announced that a fix for a very specific bug is incoming. moreâ€¦

items.title: 'Disgraceful Spurs had 11 fit players' - captain Romero
items.summary: Captain Cristian Romero says it is "disgraceful" Tottenham had just 11 senior players available for Sunday's 2-2 Premier League draw at home to Manchester City.

items.title: Everton sign Chelsea winger George on loan

items.title: Raducanu wins first match since split from coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu records her first win since out-of-sorts Australian Open performance and split from coach Francis Roig.

items.title: Welsh rider Finucane sets new world sprint record
items.summary: Emma Finucane set a new world record for the women's flying 200m time-trial at the 2026 UEC Track Elite European Championships in Turkey.

items.title: Forest sign defender Netz from Monchengladbach
items.summary: Nottingham Forest sign defender Luca Netz from Borussia Monchengladbach on a four-and-a-half-year contract.

items.title: Google Home update finally adds support for smart buttons in automations

It rests atop the SLS (Space Launch System) rocket. Orion can provide living space on missions for four astronauts for up to 21 days without docking to another spacâ€¦
items.body: NASA/Brandon Hancock NASAâ€™s Orion spacecraft , which will carry the Artemis II crew around the Moon, sits at the launch pad on Jan. 17, 2026, after rollout. It rests atop the SLS (Space Launch System) rocket. Orion can provide living space on missions for four astronauts for up to 21 days without docking to another spacecraft.  Advances in technology for deep space travel  such as life support, avionics, power systems, and state-of-the-art thermal protection will support the crew during launch, landing, and recovery. Image credit: NASA/Brandon Hancock

items.title: NASA to Discuss Early Results of Artemis II Wet Dress Rehearsal
items.summary: Following a fueling test of NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket at the launch pad for the Artemis II Moon mission, leaders will discuss initial results during a news conference at 12 p.m. EST on Tuesday, Feb. 3. The agencyâ€™s SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft arrived at Launch Pad 39B at NASAâ€™s Keâ€¦
items.body: The Moon is seen shining over the SLS (Space Launch System) and Orion spacecraft, on top of the mobile launcher on Feb. 1, 2026. The rocket is currently at Launch Pad 39B at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, as teams are preparing for a wet dress rehearsal to practice timelines and procedures for the launch of Artemis II. Credit: NASA/Sam Lott Following a fueling test of NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket at the launch pad for the Artemis II Moon mission, leaders will discuss initial results during a news conference at 12 p.m. EST on Tuesday, Feb. 3. The agencyâ€™s SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft arrived at Launch Pad 39B at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Jan. 17. Since then, engineers have been conducting a variety of tests prior to launch. Underway now is a wet dress rehearsal , which requires filling the rocket with the 700,000 gallons of propellant. Call to stations began Jan. 31, and teams are counting down to a simulated launch window opening at 9 p.m. Monday. If more work is needed, NASA may rollback SLS and Orion into the Vehicle Assembly Building after the wet dress rehearsal. The agency will stream the news conference live on its YouTube channel. A 24â€¦

items.title: 'If Arsenal don't win title now the blame will be entirely their own'

items.title: NASA Selects Axiom Space for Fifth Private Mission to Space Station
items.summary: NASA and Axiom Space have signed an order for the fifth private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, targeted to launch no earlier than January 2027 from the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. â€œThe award of our fifth private astronaut mission shows that commercial space is nâ€¦
items.body: Credit: NASA NASA and Axiom Space have signed an order for the fifth private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, targeted to launch no earlier than January 2027 from the agencyâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. â€œThe award of our fifth private astronaut mission shows that commercial space is not a distant promise, but a present reality,â€ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. â€œBy expanding access and sharpening competition in low Earth orbit, these missions are building the capabilities NASA will rely on as we move outward to the Moon, Mars, and beyond. We look forward to building upon those capabilities with many private astronaut missions to come.â€ Axiom Mission 5 is expected to spend up to 14 days aboard the space station. A specific launch date will depend on overall spacecraft traffic at the orbital outpost and other planning considerations. â€œThe International Space Station is a critical platform for enabling commercial industry in low Earth orbit,â€ said Dana Weigel, manager, International Space Station Program, NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. â€œPrivate astronaut missions allow the station to be used as a proving ground for new markets and technologiâ€¦

items.title: NASA Aims to Advance Hypersonic Flight Testing with New Awards
items.summary: While NASA is working with U.S. aviation to explore commercial supersonic technologies, the agency is also looking forward to an even faster era of flight â€“ one of vehicles that can fly hypersonic, or five times the speed of sound. And to further that vision, NASA has issued two awards for studies â€¦
items.body: 3 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The NASA award to SpaceWorks Enterprises will focus on research using the companyâ€™s X-60 platform. SpaceWorks While NASA is working with U.S. aviation to explore commercial supersonic technologies, the agency is also looking forward to an even faster era of flight â€“ one of vehicles that can fly hypersonic, or five times the speed of sound. And to further that vision, NASA has issued two awards for studies into vehicle concepts.  Some types of vehicles â€“ such as rockets â€“ achieve hypersonic speeds by carrying supplies of oxygen to allow their fuel to burn, instead of using the surrounding air. In contrast, NASAâ€™s Hypersonic Technology Project works to advance â€œairbreathing,â€ reusable hypersonic aircraft, which take in air as they fly, allowing for much longer sustained cruising at hypersonic speeds.  Given commercial interest in finding applications for airbreathing hypersonic vehicles, the Hypersonic Technology Project is looking to find ways to make testing and development easier. Two contract awards the project made â€¦

items.title: Visualizing Perseveranceâ€™s AI-Planned Drive on Mars
items.summary: Description This animation of NASAâ€™s Perseverance was created with the Caspian visualization tool using data acquired during an 807-foot (246-meter) drive on the rim of Jezero Crater made by the rover on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. The missionâ€™s â€œdrivers,â€ or rovâ€¦
items.body: 2 Min Read Visualizing Perseveranceâ€™s AI-Planned Drive on Mars PIA26646 Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech Photojournal Navigation Science Photojournal Visualizing Perseveranceâ€™sâ€¦ Photojournal Home Photojournal Search Latest Content Galleries Feedback RSS About Downloads Visualizing Perseveranceâ€™s AI-Planned Drive on Mars PNG (326.26 KB) PIA26646 Animation MP4 (157.38 MB) Description This animation of NASAâ€™s Perseverance was created with the Caspian visualization tool using data acquired during an 807-foot (246-meter) drive on the rim of Jezero Crater made by the rover on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. The missionâ€™s â€œdrivers,â€ or rover planners, use the information to understand the Perseveranceâ€™s autonomous decision-making process during its drive by showing why it chose one specific path over other options. This was one of two drives, the first being on Dec. 8, in which generative artificial intelligence provided the route planning. The AI analyzed high-resolution orbital imagery from the HiRISE (High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment) camera aboard NASAâ€™s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter and terrain-slope data from digital elevation models to identify criâ€¦

items.title: NASA Honor Awards for Cold Atom Lab Team Members
items.summary: NASA OUTSTANDING PUBLIC LEADERSHIP MEDAL Awarded for notable leadership accomplishments that have significantly influenced NASAâ€™s mission. Sustained leadership and exceptionally high-impact leadership achievements demonstrate the individualâ€™s effectiveness in advancing NASAâ€™s goals and image in preâ€¦
items.body: NASA Cold Atom Lab team members were presented with the following NASA Honor Awards. From left to right, Kamal Oudrhiri, Sarah Rees, Jason Williams, and Ethan Elliott. NASA/JPL-Caltech NASA OUTSTANDING PUBLIC LEADERSHIP MEDAL Awarded for notable leadership accomplishments that have significantly influenced NASAâ€™s mission. Sustained leadership and exceptionally high-impact leadership achievements demonstrate the individualâ€™s effectiveness in advancing NASAâ€™s goals and image in present and future terms. Kamal Oudrhiri â€“ For outstanding leadership of the Cold Atom Laboratory, NASAâ€™s first quantum laboratory in space. NASA EXCEPTIONAL SCIENTIFIC ACHIEVEMENT MEDAL Awarded for exceptional scientific contributions toward achievement of NASAâ€™s mission. This award is given for individual efforts that have resulted in a key scientific discovery or resulted in contribution(s) of fundamental importance in this field or significantly enhanced understanding of the field. Jason Williams â€“ For exceptional scientific achievements enabling and performing the first pathfinding experiments in quantum sensing of inertial forces with atom interferometry in space. NASA EXCEPTIONAL PUBLIC ACHIEVEMENT MEDâ€¦

items.title: Video: Perseverance Roverâ€™s View of Crater Rim Drive
items.summary: Description This animation shows Perseveranceâ€™s point of view during drive of 807 feet (246 meters) along the rim of Jezero Crater on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. Captured over two hours and 35 minutes, 53 Navigation Camera (Navcam) image pairs were combined with â€¦
items.body: 1 Min Read Video: Perseverance Roverâ€™s View of Crater Rim Drive PIA26647 Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech Photojournal Navigation Science Photojournal Video: Perseverance Roverâ€™sâ€¦ Photojournal Home Photojournal Search Latest Content Galleries Feedback RSS About Downloads Video: Perseverance Roverâ€™s View of Crater Rim Drive JPEG (659.02 KB) PIA26647 Animation MP4 (125.55 MB) Description This animation shows Perseveranceâ€™s point of view during drive of 807 feet (246 meters) along the rim of Jezero Crater on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. Captured over two hours and 35 minutes, 53 Navigation Camera (Navcam) image pairs were combined with rover data on orientation, wheel speed, and steering angle, as well as data from Perseveranceâ€™s Inertial Measurement Unit, and placed into a 3D virtual environment. The result is this reconstruction with virtual frames inserted about every 4 inches (0.1 meters) of drive progress. NASAâ€™s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, which is managed for the agency by Caltech, built and manages operations of the Perseverance rover. For more about Perseverance: science.nasa.gov/mission/mars-2020-perseverance/ Keep Exploring Discover More Topics Fâ€¦

items.title: Mapping Perseveranceâ€™s Route With AI
items.summary: Description This annotated image from NASAâ€™s HiRISE (High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment) camera aboard the agencyâ€™s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter image depicts the AI-planned route and the actual route taken by NASAâ€™s Perseverance Mars rover during its 807-foot (246-meter) drive on Dec. 10, 2â€¦
items.body: 2 Min Read Mapping Perseveranceâ€™s Route With AI PIA26645 Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/UofA Photojournal Navigation Science Photojournal Mapping Perseveranceâ€™s Routeâ€¦ Photojournal Home Photojournal Search Latest Content Galleries Feedback RSS About Downloads Mapping Perseveranceâ€™s Route With AI PNG (1,003.24 KB) Description This annotated image from NASAâ€™s HiRISE (High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment) camera aboard the agencyâ€™s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter image depicts the AI-planned route and the actual route taken by NASAâ€™s Perseverance Mars rover during its 807-foot (246-meter) drive on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. The drive was the second of two demonstrations â€” the first being on Dec. 8 â€” showing that generative artificial intelligence could be incorporated in the roverâ€™s route planning. The magenta lines depict the path the roverâ€™s wheels would take if it were to follow AI-processed waypoints, which are indicated with the magenta circles. (Waypoints are fixed locations where the rover takes up a new set of instructions.) The orange lines are based on data downlinked after the drive was complete and depict the actual path the rover took. Tâ€¦

On your way down, scope out the up to 56% in savings on these official Samsung Galaxy Watch 8 bandâ€¦

items.title: Google AI Plus comes to US for $7.99, Google One 2 TB upgraded
items.summary: After introducing the plan internationally in September, Google is bringing its AI Plus subscription to 35 new countries, including the US. moreâ€¦

items.title: Your next phone might have more RAM as AI-fueled shortage persists through 2027
items.summary: The ongoing memory (RAM) shortage has wide-reaching effects, but thatâ€™s not stopping new smartphones from apparently adding more RAM than prior generations, a new report states. moreâ€¦

items.title: Google AI Overviews get Gemini 3 upgrade, seamless AI Mode transfer
items.summary: Google is rolling out two notable updates to AI Overviews in Search, starting with Gemini 3. moreâ€¦

items.title: Deals: Galaxy Tab S10 FE $100 off + 50% off keyboard case, Galaxy Watch bands up to 56% off, charging stations, more

items.title: Samsung is betting bigger on iPhone-like â€˜Wide Foldâ€™ than it is on Galaxy Z TriFold
items.summary: Samsung is reportedly planning to produce 1 million units of its upcoming â€œWide Foldâ€ device that emulates the rumored iPhone Fold, overshadowing the Galaxy Z TriFoldâ€™s limited run of around 200,000 units. moreâ€¦

items.title: OnePlus says its anti-rollback measures are only temporary, downgrades returning soon
items.summary: Last week, OnePlus found itself drawing the ire of enthusiasts looking to keep the custom ROM dream alive after implementing anti-rollback measures that could result in a bricked device. Thankfully, the company now says itâ€™s a temporary situation thatâ€™ll return to normal soon. moreâ€¦

items.title: Google Wallet developing redesign that shows more cards and passes [Gallery]

items.title: Samsungâ€™s cheapest phones are getting more expensive as RAM shortage continues
items.summary: Weâ€™ve been hearing warnings for months about incoming price hikes for practically every consumer electronic on the market due, in large part, to an ongoing RAM shortage. Today, weâ€™re getting our first hints on whatâ€™s to come from Samsung throughout 2026. moreâ€¦

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
